page.title: 03CHURCHILL BUILDINGS
page.content: All that remains of the old church is the chancel, which might be part of the Norman church. It is unused and stands in the cemetery. Warren Hastings lived at Hastings House, built on the site of an earlier Manor house. Other buildings of interest were erected by James Langston (younger) in the early 19thC. They include Sarsden Glebe, built for his rector brother-in-law, Haughton House for the curate, and the Dower house at Sarsgrove for his sister. The Earl of Ducie erected a fountain in the middle of the village in memory of Langston, and also built what is now the Village Hall, as a reading room.
